snippet.textDisplay: Let me join the club and kiss your ass, sir.  I agree almost entirely.  I admittedly do enjoy CoD and other competitive shooters I think that they're generally well balanced and it's your pure skill vs your opponent's as opposed to item based games like WoW.  Playing with other people online competitively is a lot of fun, it's hard to knock that.  But I also love Fez it offers a degree of beauty, creativity, innovation, and art I'll probably never find in a competitive shooter.  Fuck EA

1) Yeah, it is focusing on online play.  2) Since AFAIK it never offered 4 player split screen.  3) Um, yeah, maybe you missed all the great 4-player FPS games like Goldeneye, Perfect Dark, TimeSplitters, and Halo.  4) I couldn't tell you what Battlefield focuses on other than realistic graphics & guns.

I don't like Battlefield or CoD because I find military shooters to be boring.  Being thrown into a war wouldn't be fun at all, so I can't fathom why people think it makes for a fun videogame.

snippet.textDisplay:
Claiming that Fez uses a "gimic, with bad art direction and mediocre graphics" sounds pretty biased.  The game's graphics and "gimic" are both tied to the story, which is based on a book called "Flatland".  The music and art direction are key to the game's mood, and again, go hand-in-hand with the story and gameplay.

I've put more time into Super Meat Boy, Braid, Limbo, and Fez than any big retail release, and not because I was trying to look hip, but because they were the most fun to play.
snippet.textOriginal:
Claiming that Fez uses a "gimic, with bad art direction and mediocre graphics" sounds pretty biased.  The game's graphics and "gimic" are both tied to the story, which is based on a book called "Flatland".  The music and art direction are key to the game's mood, and again, go hand-in-hand with the story and gameplay.

I've put more time into Super Meat Boy, Braid, Limbo, and Fez than any big retail release, and not because I was trying to look hip, but because they were the most fun to play.

snippet.textDisplay:
Agreed.  People don't hate COD to be hipsters.  I hate it because it's focus is online play, and it attracts a lot of kids and hillbilly alpha males. Goldeneye was super popular and I loved it to death.  However, I thought that the move to bigger, hi-def displays and ridiculous amounts of processing power would IMPROVE 4-player split screen games, not kill them off.  I like playing games with friends, not random potty-mouthed 13-year-olds and drunk gun nuts.

CoD just isn't fun, but Fez is.
snippet.textOriginal:
Agreed.  People don't hate COD to be hipsters.  I hate it because it's focus is online play, and it attracts a lot of kids and hillbilly alpha males. Goldeneye was super popular and I loved it to death.  However, I thought that the move to bigger, hi-def displays and ridiculous amounts of processing power would IMPROVE 4-player split screen games, not kill them off.  I like playing games with friends, not random potty-mouthed 13-year-olds and drunk gun nuts.

CoD just isn't fun, but Fez is.

Whoa, all this hate. :<
Don't hate something because it's popular. Even better: don't hate things unless they're blatantly offensive. You can share an opinion without making it so strong.
I love video games in general, I think they have great potential, and the music is one of my favorite parts of playing these games - a position that is only strengthened by the wonderful work done on the Fez soundtrack.
:3

snippet.textDisplay: Haha, wow, is this a top comment now? I wrote that a while ago and it's not my best piece, I admit. But I think you missed my main point: "Big companies like Activision and EA release the same generic shit over and over again". It's not entirely the people that play them, it's the games themselves. I don't call people sheep, that's silly: I call them stupid because they're playing the same game over and over, released with a bit of extra content. Oh, and btw: it wasn't a story. Sheep.

snippet.textDisplay: Rotate the world when you run out of things to jump onto. When you fall, you don't go to the start of the room, you go to the platform you last jumped from. Where's the risk? There is none. Riveting gameplay right there (which games like SPM and Crush have already attempted). There's no enemies, or obstacles. Older games these "retro" indie titles are trying to replicate were challenging, filled with creative ideas, and pushed the original hardware to its limits. Fez does none of this.
snippet.textOriginal: Rotate the world when you run out of things to jump onto. When you fall, you don't go to the start of the room, you go to the platform you last jumped from. Where's the risk? There is none. Riveting gameplay right there (which games like SPM and Crush have already attempted). There's no enemies, or obstacles. Older games these "retro" indie titles are trying to replicate were challenging, filled with creative ideas, and pushed the original hardware to its limits. Fez does none of this.

snippet.textDisplay:
90% of the people who think Phil Fish is a total dick for what he said about Japanese games said far worse things about the developers of Mass Effect 3's ending, no doubt.

I don't find anything wrong with what Fish said, and in fact, think the only thing that was wrong with it was that he limited his comment to just the developers in Japan and not the a-holes in the US who think re-releasing the same shit (e.g. FPS clones, classic game sequels, and sports games) is somehow acceptable.
snippet.textOriginal:
90% of the people who think Phil Fish is a total dick for what he said about Japanese games said far worse things about the developers of Mass Effect 3's ending, no doubt.

I don't find anything wrong with what Fish said, and in fact, think the only thing that was wrong with it was that he limited his comment to just the developers in Japan and not the a-holes in the US who think re-releasing the same shit (e.g. FPS clones, classic game sequels, and sports games) is somehow acceptable.

snippet.textDisplay:
I honestly don't see the problem with Fish's comments on Japanese developers. If he was in the film industry commenting on Hollywood, he would not have received this knee-jerk reaction from the media. He's an independent developer: of course he hates the major developers. In my opinion, people like him make the critical statements that are all too often absent from the discourse on media production. 

Also, props to SupraDarky for his support for this great game.
snippet.textOriginal:
I honestly don't see the problem with Fish's comments on Japanese developers. If he was in the film industry commenting on Hollywood, he would not have received this knee-jerk reaction from the media. He's an independent developer: of course he hates the major developers. In my opinion, people like him make the critical statements that are all too often absent from the discourse on media production. 

Also, props to SupraDarky for his support for this great game.

snippet.textDisplay: A lot of western game devs have been saying that recently. Have you read this month's game informer or looked online? Japanese games are getting a TON of flack. Some say they are getting stale, but some of the developers' opinions are very jaded and biased. It's quite disturbing actually.
snippet.textOriginal: A lot of western game devs have been saying that recently. Have you read this month's game informer or looked online? Japanese games are getting a TON of flack. Some say they are getting stale, but some of the developers' opinions are very jaded and biased. It's quite disturbing actually.

snippet.textDisplay: As far as I understand, all the creator said was that modern Japanese games suck. So he was just stating his opinion. Everyone is allowed to have one. Also, I love this song.

snippet.textDisplay: It's probably a good thing that you didn't hear of the controversy, so you won't be biased and will be able to enjoy Fez for what it is: a great game!

snippet.textDisplay: Then why did he say it would be on PC? The guy is a major douche, but it doesn't make his games bad.

snippet.textDisplay: What? He signed a contract with Microsoft to ONLY release Fez on the Xbox and nothing else. "Doesn't understand you can play with a controller on the PC" are you kidding me? And that was his response to people saying they'll kill him because he won the same award twice in a row, out of jealousy. It was a joke. He's right, most gamers are the worst kinds of people.

snippet.textDisplay: Wow people are still talking about what Phil Fish said? If you like Japanese video games then keep playing them, Phil Fish isn't physically blocking you from doing that with his words. Why would someone care so much about what a person said about VIDEO GAMES? Ugh!

snippet.textDisplay: I'm ashamed that I never even heard of this game before. Which is good I suppose? Since without any knowledge of the controversies that seem to have taken place, my interest is genuinely piqued now!

snippet.textDisplay: People hating on the game for the developers opinion on the gaming industry just stress his point. When he says gamers are the worst people, he's right (in a way). Just look at how demanding some people are of developers these days. Gamers demand very high (often unreasonably high) standards for games, be it graphics-wise, multiplayer-wise, or related to content abundancy. Especially for Indie Developers (like Phil), it's almost impossible to get every aspect of a game to reach the set bar.
snippet.textOriginal: People hating on the game for the developers opinion on the gaming industry just stress his point. When he says gamers are the worst people, he's right (in a way). snippet.textDisplay: It's pretty sad that people are still butt-hurt about something he said quite a while ago. He's not a jerk just because he didn't bother to sugar-coat his opinion and it in no way invalidates the fact the quality of his game. And yeah, Japanese game developers are stuck in the past and tend to get a lot more credit for innovation and creativity than they deserve (Kojima, for instance). Especially Japanese games in the past 10 to 15 years.
snippet.textOriginal: It's pretty sad that people are still butt-hurt about something he said quite a while ago. He's not a jerk just because he didn't bother to sugar-coat his opinion and it in no way invalidates the fact the quality of his game. And yeah, Japanese game developers are stuck in the past and tend to get a lot more credit for innovation and creativity than they deserve (Kojima, for instance). Especially Japanese games in the past 10 to 15 years.

snippet.textDisplay: I never said anything about giving him a free pass because he's an indie dev. Don't buy the game, I don't really care. I'm just saying you're missing out on what looks to be a good game what silly reasons. I don't think it's fair to dismiss all of the hard work he's put into the game just because of a few stupid things he's said, especially when he's not the only one who worked on it. (Like SupraDarky said with the music)
snippet.textOriginal: I never said anything about giving him a free pass because he's an indie dev. Don't buy the game, I don't really care. snippet.textDisplay: He said modern Japanese games suck, and he said that his games inspiration came from retro Japanese games. He never said this at first, it was on his Twitter that he did I believe. But still, just modern, which isn't all incorrect. There are some very good Japanese games, but not as many as there used to be, in fact there are also some very, very bad Japanese games too, but also bad western games. It's just the industry, I guess.
snippet.textOriginal: He said modern Japanese games suck, and he said that his games inspiration came from retro Japanese games. There are some very good Japanese games, but not as many as there used to be, in fact there are also some very, very bad Japanese games too, but also bad western games. It's just the industry, I guess.

snippet.textDisplay: The guy hasn't had much human contact for the last 5 years, so the fact that he doesn't know how to respond well to people makes sense. The way he responded was entirely wrong, but I just think he doesn't remember how to respond well. And people have been telling how much his game sucks for years now, he's probably tired of trying to reason with the dicks of the internet, and just resorts to doing what he knows, being a dick back to them. I don't blame him for being so harsh, though it is wrong.
snippet.textOriginal: The guy hasn't had much human contact for the last 5 years, so the fact that he doesn't know how to respond well to people makes sense. snippet.textDisplay: From WiiWare with Bit.Trip to Xbox Live Arcade with Fez. I'm definitely looking forward to playing this game. I already like the art style and the music, but I don't really know what to expect from the game itself. And that's exciting in a way. I also like the price, only 800 points. The game releases this friday but the soundtrack is already available.
